verbs.description: relitigate (third-person singular simple present relitigates, present participle relitigating, simple past and past participle relitigated)

entries.meaning: (transitive, intransitive) To litigate again; to sue or pursue legal remedy a second or further time.

examples: Like Mr bin Laden, Mr Gingrich is apparently still relitigating the victories and defeats of religious wars fought in Europe and the Middle East centuries ago.
